page.title: 04Holbeach Bank Sea Bank
page.content: The old sea bank goes through Saracen's Head and Holbeach Bank. It is called Roman Bank but it was really built by the Saxons.The sea bank was there in 1066,but it was very difficult to find out exactly when it was built.There was a saltern outside the bank at Saracen's Head before the Domesday Book was made. The villagers tried to protect themselves from the salt water by building short walls but when there was a very high tide the sea would come round them.So the villages got together and built a long bank out of stones and mud.New banks were built later and the sea is now 10km away. A road runs along a lot of the old bank and we go along it every day when we come to school.
